trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for classes that provide helper methods for processing Web requests.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline.
When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase> class.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> class.
At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility> object.
Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance.
This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
When overridden in a derived class, clears the most recent exception.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's programmatic identifier (ProgID).
The class or type of object to create an instance of.
The new object.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's type.
A type that represents the object to create.
The new object.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's class identifier (CLSID).
The class identifier of the object to create an instance of.
The new object.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process.
The URL of the handler to execute.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process and specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the executed handler.
The `writer` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.Execute%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `writer` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.Execute%2A>.
The URL of the handler to execute.
An object to capture the output.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current request, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the page and a value that indicates whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The `writer` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.Execute%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `writer` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.Execute%2A>.
The URL of the handler to execute.
The object to capture the output.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, executes the specified handler in the context of the current process, using a <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance to capture output from the executed handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The `writer` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.Execute%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `writer` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.Execute%2A>.
The HTTP handler that implements the interface to transfer the current request to.
The object to capture the output.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the most recent exception.
The most recent exception that was thrown.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, decodes an HTML-encoded string and returns the decoded string.
The HTML string to decode.
The decoded text.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, decodes an HTML-encoded string and returns the results in a stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.HtmlDecode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.HtmlDecode%2A>.
The HTML string to decode.
The stream to contain the decoded string.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, HTML-encodes a string and returns the encoded string.
The string to encode.
The HTML-encoded text.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, HTML-encodes a string and sends the resulting output to an output stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.HtmlEncode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.HtmlEncode%2A>.
The string to encode.
The stream to contain the encoded string.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the server's computer name.
The name of the server computer.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the physical file path that corresponds to the specified virtual path on the Web server.
The virtual path to get the physical path for.
The physical file path that corresponds to path.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the request time-out value in seconds.
The time-out value for requests.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a page or handler that is specified with a URL.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current page and starts execution of a different page or handler by using the specified URL and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a new request, using a custom HTTP handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP handler to transfer the current request to.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously executes the end point at the specified URL.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL and specifies whether to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form"></xref> collections.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL by using the specified HTTP method and headers.
The URL of the page or handler to execute.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP method (`GET`, `POST`, and so on) to use for the new request.
If `null`, the HTTP method of the original request is used.
A collection of request headers for the new request.
Always.

When implemented in a derived class, asynchronously executes the end point at the specified URL, using the specified HTTP method, headers, path, and options to preserve form values and preserve the user identity.
The path.

`true` to preserve the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections; `false` to clear the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> collections.
The HTTP method to use for the new request.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object that contains request headers for the new request.
`true` to preserve the user identity; otherwise, `false`.
Other overloads of this method call this method overload with the preserveUser parameter set to `true`.
When overridden in a derived class, decodes a URL-encoded string and returns the decoded string.
The string to decode.
The decoded text.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, decodes a URL-encoded string and sends the resulting output to a stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.UrlDecode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.HtmlDecode%2A>.
The string to decode.
The stream to contain the decoded string.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, URL-encodes a string and returns the encoded string.
The text to URL-encode.
The URL-encoded text.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, URL-encodes a string and sends the resulting output to a stream.
The `output` parameter is passed by reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase.UrlEncode%2A> method.
To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the `output` object.
For an example, see <xref:System.Web.HttpServerUtility.UrlEncode%2A>.
The string to encode.
The stream to contain the encoded string.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, URL-encodes the path section of a URL string.
The string to URL-encode.
The URL-encoded text.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, decodes a URL string token into an equivalent byte array by using base64-encoded digits.
The URL string token to decode.
The byte array that contains the decoded URL token.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, encodes a byte array into an equivalent string representation by using base64 digits, which makes it usable for transmission on the URL.
The byte array to encode.
The string that contains the encoded array if the length of input is greater than 1; otherwise, an empty string ("")
Always.
